business.headline: Applying for a personal loan? How many years of ITRs do you needBanks need to be sure you can pay back the money you borrow. For salaried individuals, a regular pay cheque and Form 16 usually provide enough assurance. However, for self-employed individuals, ITRs over several years give a more consistent and reliable picture of earnings and financial health.
Raymond Realty likely to list in early July, says chairman Gautam SinghaniaEach shareholder will receive one share of Raymond Realty for every share held in Raymond, the group said previously.

Sensex, Nifty end flat as profit booking halts rally; IT gains capped by banksThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 53.49 points to end at 82,391.72, while the NSE Nifty50 ended flat with a gain of 1 point to 25,104.25.

Mutual fund inflows fall: Should beginners still trust SIPs or go for stocks?Data from the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) shows that net inflows into equity schemes dropped 22% month-on-month to Rs 19,013 crore in May, marking the fifth straight month of decline and the weakest level since April 2024.

India emerges as Apple's new bet, but China and Trump raise red flags: ReportLast week, Foxconn announced a fresh $1.5 billion investment in its Indian operations, offering some reassurance to officials in New Delhi. This move may ease tensions in New Delhi that began when Donald Trump publicly stated he told Tim Cook not to expand Apple's manufacturing in India, casting doubt on hopes that most iPhones for the US would be made in India by 2026.
Filing under old tax regime? New ITR rules you should know in 2025Key changes in the Income Tax Return (ITR) filing process for those opting for the old tax regime in the Assessment Year 2025–26.

Rupee stuck in neutral as Asia's currencies race ahead on weak dollarWhile the Singapore dollar, Korean won, and Taiwanese dollar have jumped between 6% and 9.5% so far this year, the rupee has barely moved.

Mutual fund SIPs continue strong run, touch Rs 26,688 crore in May: AMFIMutual fund SIPs reached a fresh high of Rs 26,688 crore in May, inching up from Rs 26,632 crore the previous month, as per AMFI data released on June 10.

RCB to get new owner? Diageo looking for stake sale, says reportDiageo Plc, the British company that owns RCB through its Indian arm United Spirits Ltd., is exploring options to sell a part or all of its stake in the franchise.

Planning to pay 0 tax by setting up in Dubai? Coinswitch co-founder calls it a trapStarting a company in Dubai sounds appealing with no income tax and easy formalities. But if you operate from India, authorities might still consider it an Indian firm. Here's why.

Lilavati Trust hits back at HDFC Bank, rejects outstanding duesIn a sharply worded statement issued Monday, the Trust asserted that neither it nor its permanent trustee Prashant Kishor Mehta has ever borrowed from HDFC Bank.

Paras Defence shares in focus today, rise over 1% in early trade. Here's whyAlongside the 1:2 stock split, Paras Defence also declared its first-ever dividend of Rs 0.50 per share during its Q4 FY25 earnings on April 30. The announcement came on the back of a strong financial performance for the quarter.

entertainment.headline: Dipika Kakar shares health update after 14-hour surgery for liver cancerActor Dipika Kakar has shared her health update on her husband Shoaib Ibrahim's recent YouTube vlog. Dipika underwent a 14-surgery after being diagnosed with stage 2 liver cancer.

Kunal Kapoor debuts sharp jawline in BTS pics from Ramayana, fans reactActor Kunal Kapoor is playing the role of Lord Indra in 'Ramayana', which also stars Ranbir Kapoor and Sai Pallavi as Lord Ram and Goddess Sita. Check out his latest behind-the-scenes pictures from the sets.

Amitabh Bachchan's folded-hands reply to X user's jibe at his age and longevityAmitabh Bachchan clapped back at a troll who tried to take a jibe at his age and sleep in the comment section of his post on X. Big B maintained grace and sarcasm as he responded to the social media user.

How director Tarun Mansukhani predicted Priyanka's global success with 'Desi Girl'Director Tarun Mansukhani fondly remembered the creation of the iconic song 'Desi Girl' and his rare, agenda-free friendship with Priyanka Chopra. He also revealed his heartfelt wish to visit and shoot in Kashmir, highlighting his love for India in an exclusive conversation with India Today.

Amol Parashar reacts to dating rumours with Konkana SensharmaActor Amol Parashar has addressed dating rumours involving his 'Dolly Kitty Aur Wo Chamakte Sitare' co-star Konkona Sensharma. Amol said that if he had any news to share, he would share it himself on his social media.

Varun Grover explains his 'no' comment on Anurag Kashyap's old love letter to VangaWriter and comedian Varun Grover wrote 'no' in the comments section when Anurag Kashyap dedicated a long note to Sandeep Reddy Vanga, calling him a 'misunderstood filmmaker'. He now clarified why he didn't agree with the post.

Navjot Sidhu welcomes Sultan of Sultans, Salman Khan, on Kapil Sharma's show. PicsNavjot Singh Sidhu recently shared some fun pictures from 'The Great Indian Kapil Show 3' ahead of its premiere. Actor Salman Khan will be seen as a special guest in one of the upcoming episodes.

K-pop idol Jackson Wang greets with a namaste as he arrives in IndiaK-pop idol Jackson Wang has arrived in Mumbai for an extended visit to promote his new album and engage with fans. This trip signals a deeper cultural connection and growing K-pop focus on India.

Influencer accuses Remo D'Souza of copying dance moves in Housefull 5's Laal PariA social media influencer, Sandip Brahamin, has accused Bollywood choreographer Remo D'Souza of copying his dance moves in 'Housefull 5' song Laal Pari.  The makers of the film and Remo D'Souza are yet to respond to his claims.

Vivek Agnihotri renames The Delhi Files to The Bengal Files on public demandFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has announced a new title for his upcoming political drama, earlier called 'The Delhi Files'. The filmmaker has changed the name to 'The Bengali Files' due to public demand.

Maldives names Katrina Kaif as global tourism ambassador ahead of PM Modi's visitActor Katrina Kaif was announced as the global tourism ambassador for the Maldives on Tuesday. The development comes a month before PM Modi's scheduled visit to the island country.

Ram Charan, wife Upasana celebrate newlyweds Akhil Akkineni, Zainab with new picsRam Charan and his wife Upasana Kamineni wished newlyweds Akhil Akkineni and Zainab Ravdjee. She shared new pictures from their intimate wedding and reception.

Deepika Padukone announces badminton school in birthday post for father PrakashDeepika Padukone dedicated a beautiful note to her father and legendary badminton player, Prakash Padukone, as she announced the launch of the 'Padukone School of Badminton' on his 70th birthday.

Gurdas Maan's brother Gurpanth dies at 68 in Mohali, last rites to be held todayPunjabi singer-turned-actor Gurdas Maan's younger brother reportedly died in Mohali on Monday. His last rites will be held today (June 10) in Chandigarh.

Neha Dhupia backs Deepika's 8-hour shift call, says new moms need practical supportActor Neha Dhupia wrote a note on social media, supporting Deepika Padukone's reported demand for an eight-hour work shift. She tagged Padukone on her Instagram stories, telling all that new mothers don't just require lip service.

Housefull 5 box office Day 4: Fastest film in franchise to enter Rs 100 crore clubAkshay Kumar's 'Housefull 5' surpassed the Rs 100 crore-mark in India after five days of theatrical run. The film witnessed a drop on Monday, but nothing that wasn't expected or could play a deterrent in its longer run.

Amanda Seyfried accuses Paramount of owing her money for Mean Girls merchandiseActor Amanda Seyfried has revealed that she has not received royalties from Paramount Pictures for 'Mean Girls' merchandise featuring her image. The issue extends to other cast members, raising concerns about unpaid earnings from the popular 2004 teen film.

How Kamal Haasan's Thug Life failed its women: Trisha, Abhirami, Aishwarya LekshmiDirector Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life', starring Kamal Haasan and Silambarasan, has been receiving mixed reviews from critics and audiences. However, the biggest injustice was meted out to the women in the film, played by Trisha Krishnan, Abhirami and Aishwarya Lekshmi.

BTS are back: What to expect from the return of Kings of K-popBTS members have started returning from military service, marking the end of a long hiatus and sparking excitement across the K-pop world. HYBE shares have surged as fans and investors anticipate a major comeback and global tour.

general news.headline: Not a right to visit US: Embassy's message amid Indian student handcuffing rowThe US embassy in India has said that although the country continues to welcome legitimate travellers, illegal entry, abuse of visas or violation of US law will not be tolerated.

Saat janmon ka saath post gave Sonam away: Op Honeymoon probe reveals murder planTwo days after Raja Raghuvanshi's murder, Sonam travelled from Shillong to Indore on May 25 via Siliguri by train. In Indore, Sonam met with her alleged lover Raj and stayed in a rented house before reaching Uttar Pradesh's Ghazipur, where she surrendered.

Bengal porn racket accused pictured with Trinamool leaders, BJP mounts attackAmid the ongoing uproar over the Bengal porn racket row, a Facebook profile under the name Sweta Khatoon has emerged, showing the accused posing with several Trinamool leaders and attending party events, including iftar gatherings.

They fought in Class 4. Over 50 years later, one of them took revenge at reunionTwo men were arrested in Kasaragod, Kerala, for attacking a 62-year-old man over a fight that happened over 50 years ago. The victim, VJ Babu, had allegedly attacked one of the men while in fourth grade. Babu is undergoing treatment for his injuries.

How BJP flipped the script in a year. Explained in 5 pointsSilencing murmurs of a mid-term collapse, the BJP-led Narendra Modi 3.0 has turned the tables in one year after it took office in June 2024. In just 12 months, the BJP has won three key assembly polls, and has shown the will to push for major legislative overhauls, keeping allies content and intact. Operation Sindoor has proven to be the icing on the cake, which has galvanised sentiments and support for the Narendra Modi-led Centre.

11 dead in Austria school shooting, suspect killed himselfAt least 11 people, including the suspect, were killed in a shooting at a school in Austria's Graz. The suspect's body was found in the washroom, local media reported.

Why fighter pilots like Shubhanshu Shukla are chosen for space travelThe tradition of selecting pilots as astronauts dates back to the very dawn of the Space Age. In fact, the first human to venture into space in 1961, cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin was a trained fighter pilot.

Assam woman found dead in Uttarakhand, was missing for 5 days since Delhi visitA 20-year-old woman from Assam, who went missing since coming to Delhi on June 5 for a Railway Recruitment Board exam, was found dead in Uttarakhand's Pauri.

Want to get your face insured? You might not stand a chanceThe term face insurance created quite a hullabaloo on social media, thanks to Karan Johar. While we are still unsure if the producer-director actually got his face insured for real, one thing is for sure: it piqued a lot of interest amongst people.

Deportee to India breaks free at Heathrow runway, caught and pinned downA probe has been launched after an immigration detainee, due for deportation to India, escaped custody and ran across the tarmac of London's Heathrow Airport. A video of the incident surfaced on the internet. The man was chased by the airport security before being detained by the police. He was made to reboard his onward flight.

15 months on, delay in Apache delivery from US keeps Indian Army squadron idleThe squadron, established in March 2024 at Nagtalao in Jodhpur, remains non-operational due to repeated delays in the delivery of Apache AH-64E helicopters from the United States.

Karnataka High Court's 9 big questions to state in Bengaluru stampede caseThe Karnataka High Court sharply criticised the state government while hearing petitions in the Bengaluru stampede case. It questioned procedural lapses, sought accountability and demanded answers to nine key queries regarding crowd management, permissions and emergency preparedness.

Five reasons why Indian sub-continent has changed post Operation SindoorFrom ending Pak nuclear blackmail to boosting Indian weapons - Operation Sindoor is the biggest masterstroke since the 1998 Pokharan nuclear tests.

ChatGPT is down: Some users unable to access the AI chatbot on mobile and webChatGPT is not working for some users on both the mobile app and on the web. The AI chatbot shows a "something seems to have gone wrong" error message.

Stampede in Bengaluru during RCB celebrations very disappointing: Rahul DravidRahul Dravid expressed anguish over the tragic stampede during RCB's IPL victory celebrations in Bengaluru. 11 people were killed and over 50 injured in the stampede, which has raised serious concerns over crowd management capabilities of the city.

Sharmishta Panoli's complainant Wajahat Khan denied bail, sent to police custodyWajahat Khan was arrested by the Kolkata Police on June 9 after allegedly being on the run since June 1. He was arrested following a series of raids after multiple summons were ignored.

From bloating to diarrhoea: Delhi's heatwave triggers stomach illnessesDelhi is experiencing a severe heatwave with temperatures soaring up to 45 degrees Celsius. This extreme heat is causing digestive problems with concerns over dehydration and food safety.

Father, two children jump to death while escaping fire at home in Delhi's DwarkaThree members of a family jumped to death after a fire broke out at their apartment on the seventh floor of a multi-storied building. The incident took place in Delhi's Dwarka area on Tuesday morning.

Should we stay or leave? Indian students at Harvard caught in Trump's crossfireIndian students at Harvard are facing a "rollercoaster" of uncertainty and anxiety amid the Donald Trump administration's relentless crackdown on the prestigious university. They are wondering whether to go back to India or stay in the US for job opportunities.

RCB to get new owner? Diageo looking for stake sale, says reportDiageo Plc, the British company that owns RCB through its Indian arm United Spirits Ltd., is exploring options to sell a part or all of its stake in the franchise.

How Kamal Haasan's Thug Life failed its women: Trisha, Abhirami, Aishwarya LekshmiDirector Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life', starring Kamal Haasan and Silambarasan, has been receiving mixed reviews from critics and audiences. However, the biggest injustice was meted out to the women in the film, played by Trisha Krishnan, Abhirami and Aishwarya Lekshmi.

Ax-4 launch: Not just weather, SpaceX also found Falcon engine issuesThe Falcon 9 uses a mix of rocket-grade kerosene and supercooled liquid oxygen, making leak containment critical for stable combustion and thrust generation.

Greta Thunberg deported from Israel day after Gaza-bound ship seizedIsrael deported activist Greta Thunberg from the country and was headed to France and then Sweden, a day after she was aboard a Gaza-bound ship that was seized by the Israeli military.

Don't like husband getting intimate, Indore woman texted 'lover' days before murderMeghalaya murder case: Sonam Raghuvanshi, accused of killing her husband Raja Raghuvanshi on their honeymoon in Meghalaya, told her lover she did not like her husband getting intimate with her, sources told India Today TV.

sports.headline: Australia announce XI for WTC final, Labuschagne picked as makeshift openerAustralia have named a makeshift opener and two medium pace all-rounders for the WTC final against South Africa at Lord's. Cameron Green returns to the XI and he will play at No. 3, confirmed captain Pat Cummins on Tuesday, June 10.

No surprises as South Africa name playing XI for WTC Final vs AustraliaSouth Africa enter the WTC Final with a settled, in-form squad — hoping their consistent selection and a balance of youth and experience will help overcome Pat Cummins' Australia at the historic Lord's Cricket Ground.

Stampede in Bengaluru during RCB celebrations very disappointing: Rahul DravidRahul Dravid expressed anguish over the tragic stampede during RCB's IPL victory celebrations in Bengaluru. 11 people were killed and over 50 injured in the stampede, which has raised serious concerns over crowd management capabilities of the city.

Not our style: Pat Cummins says Australia won't use drug ban to sledge Kagiso RabadaPat Cummins has assured that Australia will not use Kagiso Rabada's drug ban to sledge him during the World Test Championship final. He also reflected on his initial doubts about captaincy and highlighted the smooth team transition with emerging young players.

No weak links in Australia, SA will have to toil to win WTC: Sanjay BangarFormer India cricketer Sanjay Bangar has said that Australia have no weak links in their team for the World Test Championship final 2025, while replying to a query from India Today's Rishabh Beniwal during a media interaction. He further said that South Africa will have to work extremely hard to come out on top in the all-important clash.

WTC win can be South Africa's eureka moment like India's 1983 triumph: Sanjay BangarFormer India cricketer turned commentator Sanjay Bangar feels that a win in the WTC final 2025 will have the same impact on South Africa cricket as the 1983 World Cup triumph had on Indian cricket. Bangar also mentioned that since 2025 has been the year of underdogs in sporting world, South Africa's win can go a long way towards the relevance and importance of the WTC.

Ruturaj Gaikwad signs up with Yorkshire for County season and One-day CupYorkshire have signed India batter Ruturaj Gaikwad for the remainder of the county season. The Chennai Super Kings skipper aims to make an immediate impact and help Yorkshire win silverware.

R Ashwin handed hefty fine for violent outburst during TNPL match: ReportRavichandran Ashwin was fined 30 percent of his match fee for a violent outburst during a TNPL game. The incident took place on Sunday, June 8, during the clash between Dindigul Dragons and Tiruppur Tamizhans.

Viswanathan Anand set to make return in World Rapid and Blitz team championshipFive-time world champion Viswanathan Anand returns to compete in the World Rapid and Blitz team chess championship. The tournament features top international players but misses Magnus Carlsen, adding intrigue to the competition.

Rohit Sharma's Test average would've dropped to 30s in England: Sanjay ManjrekarFormer India cricketer turned commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said that Rohit Sharma's Test average would've taken a massive hit, had he decided to play in the upcoming England series beginning from June 20.

World Test Championship final key to Australia's quest for greatness: Nathan LyonNathan Lyon emphasises the importance of the World Test Championship final for Australia's cricketing journey to becoming one of the greatest Test sides of all time. The Aussies aim to retain their crown while facing a tough South African side at Lord's.

Ruturaj Gaikwad signs up with Yorkshire for County season and One-day CupYorkshire have signed India batter Ruturaj Gaikwad for the remainder of the county season. The Chennai Super Kings skipper aims to make an immediate impact and help Yorkshire win silverware.

R Ashwin handed hefty fine for violent outburst during TNPL match: ReportRavichandran Ashwin was fined 30 percent of his match fee for a violent outburst during a TNPL game. The incident took place on Sunday, June 8, during the clash between Dindigul Dragons and Tiruppur Tamizhans.

Viswanathan Anand set to make return in World Rapid and Blitz team championshipFive-time world champion Viswanathan Anand returns to compete in the World Rapid and Blitz team chess championship. The tournament features top international players but misses Magnus Carlsen, adding intrigue to the competition.

Rohit Sharma's Test average would've dropped to 30s in England: Sanjay ManjrekarFormer India cricketer turned commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said that Rohit Sharma's Test average would've taken a massive hit, had he decided to play in the upcoming England series beginning from June 20.

World Test Championship final key to Australia's quest for greatness: Nathan LyonNathan Lyon emphasises the importance of the World Test Championship final for Australia's cricketing journey to becoming one of the greatest Test sides of all time. The Aussies aim to retain their crown while facing a tough South African side at Lord's.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
